HR Manager Job at Planet Resources Limited




        
    

        
        Planet Resources Limited, established in 2000, has fast become a market leading security company with a proven track record in providing the highest standards of customer care to both the private and public sectors of the aviation industry in Nigeria. Planet Resources has achieved NCAA Accreditation, and as such understands the importance and value that is placed on security.

Our Services includes: Aircraft cabin search, aircraft guarding, passenger & cabin baggage screening, cargo security, catering security, travel document examination and crowd management, hold baggage security, baggage reconciliation, aircraft ramp security, hand baggage control, passenger profiling, tag reconciliation etc.

Job Location: Agege Motor Road, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

	Support workforce planning, succession planning, and organizational development initiatives.

CLO Administrative Assistant Job at U.S Consulate




        
    

        
        The U.S. Mission to Nigeria comprises of the Embassy in Abuja, FCT, and the Consulate General in Lagos. U.S. Consulate General Lagos is the Mission’s representative to the Nigerian people in the southern region.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: ??CLO Administrative Assistant

Announcement Number: Lagos-2025-033
Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full Time
Hiring Agency: Consulate General Lagos

Summary
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The U.S. Consulate Lagos, Nigeria is seeking eligible and qualified applicants for the CLO Administrative Assistant position in the Management Section.


Duties


	The Community Liaison Office Administrative Assistant (CLO Administrative Assistant) provides administrative support to the Community Liaison Office.
	The CLO Administrative Assistant works under the supervision of the CLO Coordinator and collaborates with the entirety of the CLO staff (CLO Coordinator and Assistant CLO Coordinator) to support the office in successful programming under all eight Areas of Responsibility (family member employment; crisis management and security; education; communications and outreach; guidance and referral; welcoming, orientation, and departures; community liaison; and events planning), to develop and maintain key contacts, and to manage information that benefits the morale and welfare of the entire Mission.


Educational Qualifications


	Completion of High School is required.


Experience:


	Two (2) years of administrative / office experience is required.


Requirements:


	All selected candidates must be able to obtain and hold a low risk/non-sensitive clearance.
	All selected candidates will be subject to a background investigation and may be subject to a pre-employment medical exam. 
	Selected candidate must be able to begin working within a reasonable period of time (6 weeks) upon receipt of agency authorization and/or clearances/certifications or their candidacy may end.


Language:


	Good working knowledge: speaking/reading/writing in English is required.


Job Knowledge:


	Basic understanding of the Foreign Service concept and the structure of the U.S. federal government is required.
	Knowledge of general principles of office administration and management is required.
	Standard knowledge of Microsoft Office is required.


Skills and Abilities:


	Ability to draft communications and reports is required.
	Strong organizational skills (physical and digital organization of office files) is required.
	Strong research skills and proficiency in the use of Microsoft 365 is required.


Salary
USD 43,112 Annually.

  "title": "Fleet Officer",
  "description": "Sunrose Consulting Limited -&nbsp;Our client provides unmatched logistics support in leisure and business to individuals and corporate clients in Vehicle Rental, Fleet Management, Leasing and Manpower Outsourcing. It is designed for the discerning traveler and the optimisation manager. The company has over 25years experience in all round Transportation Management Services.
With branches in Lagos, Kano, Abuja, Calabar, Accra (Ghana), as well as outlets through strategic alliances with hotels, resorts, sports and entertainment venues, the company is positioned to meeting its clients&rsquo; transport logistics needs.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Fleet Officer
Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Purpose


	The Fleet Officer plays a vital role in ensuring the smooth operations and maintenance of the fleet of vehicles in the company.


Key Responsibilities


	Maintain meticulous records on fleet operations, vehicle maintenance, and fuel consumption.
	Regularly schedule and conduct site visits to clients&#39; and vehicle locations. Review and assess on-site driver and vehicle activities, ensuring compliance and service quality.
	Effectively manage vehicle-related complaints. Receive and document complaints from drivers, and promptly liaise with the maintenance unit to initiate necessary checks and repairs.

  "description": "TheHRHive -&nbsp;Our client, Atinudah is a storytelling-driven creative company that crafts unforgettable experiences across branding, events, and content. Their work spans high-impact campaigns, immersive experiences, and creator-led content that shapes culture and community. They move fast, think big, and execute boldly.

They are building a world-class creative team, one that blends design, production, and strategy. If you dream in visual systems, think in timelines, and love translating ideas into impact, Atinudah is your canvas.

They are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Creative Director

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

About the Role


	We are seeking a multidisciplinary Creative Director who thrives at the intersection of strategy, design, motion, and production.
	You will oversee the creative direction and execution across all Atinudah&rsquo;s projects, from campaign systems and event environments to social-first content and branded storytelling.
	This role is for a creative leader who builds teams, not just ideas.
	You must be just as comfortable reviewing storyboards and deck layouts as you are discussing lighting setups, stage dimensions, or video deliverables.
	You&rsquo;ll manage a team of designers and collaborate with internal departments, vendors, and clients, all while upholding the highest standard of creative quality.


Key Responsibilities
Creative Vision &amp; Brand Leadership:


	Own and evolve Atinudah&rsquo;s creative direction across events, campaigns, branding, and content.
	Lead visual and conceptual storytelling for client and internal projects, ensuring brand consistency and innovation.
	Act as a guardian of taste, craft, and culture, setting the tone for how Atinudah shows up across all platforms.


Content, Design &amp; Motion Oversight:


	Guide design teams across static (graphics, decks, print) and dynamic (video, motion, animation) outputs. This includes creating across these platforms.
	Create, review and refine visuals, from logo systems and brand guides to Instagram reels and explainer videos.
	Ensure content aligns with strategy and resonates with real audiences, not just aesthetics.


Production &amp; Event Intelligence:


	Collaborate on large-scale event visual direction, from screens to stage setup, signage to motion assets.
	Understand event production realities: stage dimensions, screen resolutions, branding surfaces, lighting design, and flow.
	Coordinate with producers and vendors to ensure ideas can be built without compromising creative excellence.


Team &amp; Vendor Management:


	Lead and mentor a growing team of designers, animators, and content creators, ensuring clarity, ownership, and accountability.
	Onboard and oversee freelancers and agencies when needed, providing clear briefs and creative direction.
	Build a feedback culture with high standards and mutual respect.


Creative Strategy &amp; Business Impact:


	Translate business goals and campaign strategies into compelling creative systems.
	Present creative work internally and externally, with clarity, story, and conviction.
	Balance creative ambition with resource realities, time constraints, and deliverables.


Trends, Tools &amp; Innovations:


	Stay current with design, media, tech, and cultural trends and help Atinudah stay ahead of the curve.
	Experiment with new tools (AI, prototyping software, real-time collaboration) to speed up and elevate the creative process.


Requirements


	5 - 7 years of experience in creative direction, art direction, or design leadership roles across agencies, media, branding, or production.
	A strong portfolio that spans branding, digital, motion, experiential, and content &mdash; showing taste, systems thinking, and creative leadership.


Mastery of:


	Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, After Effects, Premiere)
	Figma or Sketch for digital and layout collaboration
	Bonus: Lightroom, Final Cut, or DaVinci for production awareness.


Experience overseeing:


	Creative teams (graphic/motion designers, video editors, content creators)
	Vendors in photo/video production, event fabrication, and brand rollout
	Comfort creating &amp; reviewing everything from moodboards to storyboards, from creative decks to 3D stage renderings.
	Excellent communication skills - you can explain ideas, give feedback, and present with confidence to leadership or clients.
	A good balance of artistic instinct and executional discipline.
	A strong understanding of brand storytelling, visual hierarchy, typography, color theory, and spatial design.
	Comfort managing multiple projects and teams, while delivering consistently high-quality creative on time.


Bonus If You Bring:


	Knowledge of UI/UX principles or experience designing product interfaces.
	Working knowledge of photography or video workflows (pre-production, shoots, editing).
	Experience with experiential marketing or stage/event branding.
	Experience working with or leading creative teams in Africa or building culturally relevant campaigns.


Remuneration
Competitive.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;thehrhive@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",
